page.title: 16Farming in the Bramley area.
page.content: There are{6 farm houses}in the area:Brook Lane Farm, Sandy Lane Farm, Moat Farm, Grange Farm, Parkcliffe,and Millstone Farm. The farmers also rent land. Other people,such as Mrs.Johnson and estates, such as Ward Aldam, the Local Council,and the Church of England, also own land in this area. None of the machinery is rented. { There is mixed farming here _ arable {and livestock. Their{crops}are cereals,eg barley,and vegetables: potatoes, cauliflowers, sprouts, cabbage and turnips.While the cereals are sold to grain merchants, the vegetables are sold direct to the public,thus cutting out a "middle man" { Livestock}has decreased over the last few years.There is a pig unit in the area_Moat Farm.Most cattle are for beef production, not dairy.There is no poultry kept for commercial purposes.
